snippet: The constitutional protection from searches without a warrant should include protection from the police using a dog to smell for drugs.
abstract: Editorial urges Supreme Court to protect right to privacy and freedom from unreasonable government intrusion when it decides on two cases involving dogs used to detect illegal drugs; observes that dogs are not infallible, and such searches, if deemed legal, set precedent for searches without a warrant or proof of wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: The constitutional protection from searches without a warrant should include protection from the police using a dog to smell for drugs.

headline.seo: Drug-Sniffing Dogs and the Fourth Amendment
headline.main: Sniffing Dogs and the Fourth Amendment
headline.print_headline: Sniffing Dogs and the Fourth Amendment
